resources.string: Open Music Center app on the watch to initiate connection
This feature allows you to pick custom icon for your action from installed icon pack.\n\nUnfortunately it appears you do not have any icon packs installed.

This feature allows you to pick custom icon for your action from installed icon pack.\n\nSome icon packs require apps to have storage permission. You will need to allow it in order to use this feature.
Buy me a Coke if you really like my app!
Send application logs to the developer for the support
Current time will only be displayed in ambient mode
Current time will always be displayed. Top action icon will not be visible (it will be replaced by clock), but action will still function normally.
Tap this notification and check Music Center to fix the issue
Notification service is not enabled. You must enable it to get this app to work!
Automatically pause any playback when exiting Music Center on the watch via swipe-left gesture.\n\nExiting via power button is not affected and it will never auto-pause.

Rotating inputs (for example rotating crowns) can be oversensitive on some devices. To prevent accidental volume changes, rotary input will be disabled for %1$s milliseconds after you turn the screen on.
Disable physical button double click in ambient

Some watches have buggy buttons where single click of the physical button in ambient mode sometimes gets registered as double click.\n\nIf you experience this, you can enable this option to completely disable double clicks in ambient mode (e.g. clicking twice will just activate single click action). Clicking button twice when watch is active is not affected.
Vibrate the watch when pressing buttons.
Automatically open the Music Center on the watch when music playback is started on the phone.
List of media apps that can auto-start Music Center
Open queue with swipe up gesture
When enabled, swiping up will display playback queue instead of actions menu. You can still open actions menu by assigning "Open actions menu" action to any button.

Music Center will automatically close itself when there is no music playing for %1$s seconds. Feature is disabled when timeout is set to 0 seconds. Please not that, to save battery, this option may not be too accurate at times and it might delay the closing for up to a minute.

This feature requires another app to manage notifications (Vibration Center for Wear).\n\nWhenever Vibration Center vibrates the watch, Music Center will display popup of the notification text, allowing you to glance at notification quickly without leaving Music Center.
Notification popup will automatically close itself after %1$s seconds. Enter 0 to disable auto-close.
To use this feature, you will need to install another (free) app: Vibration Center for Wear.
Sorry, your device does not appear to support notification services
When enabled, tapping on action list will always select center (highlighted) option, regardless of what option you tapped.
Not supported by this media app
